p: Daikonâ€™s EO exhibited the most varied composition, both in terms of individual compounds and chemical classes. Oxygenated diterpenes, of which phytol was the only representative, were detected as the most abundant chemical group (29.0%). Non-terpene derivatives closely followed (27.7%), with ( Z)-3-hexen-1-ol (11.0%) and nonanal (5.3%) as the most abundant.
